notes_table¶

class tracktor_server.notes_table.Notes(db_name)¶

Bases: object

Class to manage connection to the backend Notes table.

This class provides methods to to write/read from a SQLite database directly, while main.py handles the requests and calls on these functions.

db_name¶

The name of the SQLite database file.

Type:

str

connection¶

The database connection.

Type:

sqlite3.Connection or None

add_note(item_type, item_id, item_dept, message, user, timestamp=None)¶

Creates a note to a specified item

Parameters:

  • item_type (str) – The type of item (e.g., ‘shot’, ‘asset’).

  • item_id (int) – The ID of the item.

  • item_dept (str) – The department (e.g., ‘LAY’, ‘ANI’).

  • message (str) – The note body.

  • user (str) – The author of the note.

  • timestamp (str) – The timestamp for the note. If None, uses current time.

Returns:

The ID of the newly created note.

Return type:

int

get_all_notes()¶

Get all existing notes

Returns:

A list of all note rows.

Return type:

list[sqlite3.Row]

get_db()¶

Opens the named database or creates one if it doesn’t exist.

Returns:

The db connection object.

Return type:

sqlite3.Connection

get_note_by_id(note_id)¶

Returns a single not by its note_id.

Parameters:

note_id (int) – The ID of the note.

Returns:

The note row, or None if not found.

Return type:

sqlite3.Row

get_notes(item_type, item_id)¶

Gets all notes for the item

Parameters:

  • item_type (str) – The type of item.

  • item_id (int) – The ID of the item.

Returns:

A list of note rows for the item.

Return type:

list[sqlite3.Row]

get_notes_for_dept(item_type, item_id, item_dept)¶

Get all notes relevant to the item’s dept (LAY, ANI), etc

Parameters:

  • item_type (str) – The type of item.

  • item_id (int) – The ID of the item.

  • item_dept (str) – The department.

Returns:

A list of note rows for the department.

Return type:

list[sqlite3.Row]

init_notes_table()¶

Creates an SQL table for notes if it doesn’t already exist.

Tracktor VFX
